business.headline: US tariff of 25% puts several sectors at risk, but what's the fix?Experts said that sectors like gems and jewellery, seafood exports, and auto components are likely to feel the immediate effects of the 25% tariffs announced by the US.
Behind the delayed US-India trade deal: A standoff over farmsAt the centre of the friction is a long-standing issue that has repeatedly stalled negotiations between the two countries: agriculture.

Trump's 25% tariffs: These stocks and sectors are in the firing lineBoth the main indices on Dalal Street fell sharply in early trade, and despite recovering by noon, the mood remains tense after Washington's move threatened to upend trade flows across key sectors.

Who are the 6 Indian firms sanctioned by the US and what's at stake?Six Indian firms have been sanctioned by the US for allegedly importing Iranian petrochemicals. Here's all you need to know about them.

ITR-U now open: Update your past ITR mistakes for AY 2021-22 and 2022-23The Income Tax Department has now made it possible to file updated returns (ITR-U) for Assessment Years (AY) 2021-22 and 2022-23 using the ITR-1 and ITR-2 forms. This move aims to help people fix any errors or income details they may have missed earlier.

Trump's 25% tariffs: Which sectors should brace for impact?US President Donald Trump announced a 25% tariff on Indian exports starting August 1.  An additional penalty was also announced for India's continued oil purchases from Russia, which has added more uncertainty for businesses.

Explained: Why Trump's 25% tariff is a double whammy for IndiaThe move comes at a time when Indian exports are already under pressure and global demand remains uneven. It also marks a sharp deterioration in bilateral negotiations that had, until recently, appeared to be progressing toward a limited trade understanding.

Sensex falls 500 points: Why is stock market down todayHeavyweight stocks fell in early trade. The S&P BSE Sensex fell over 575 points in early trade to 80,907.34, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 185 points to 24,670.15 by 10 am.
US calls India the 'tariff king'. But its own duties go as high as 350%Donald Trump has called India tariff king, but the U.S. quietly charges 350% on milk, tobacco, and fruit.
Sensex opens 590 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; RIL shares fall 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 536.92 points to 80,944.94, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 156.35 points to 24,698.70 as of 9:26 am.

Trump announces 25% tariff: Why India and US still don't have a trade dealDespite several rounds of talks, the two nations have not managed to bridge key differences. Speaking at a press conference at the White House, Trump said that India remains one of the highest tariff-imposing countries in the world, but discussions are underway.

US imposes 25% tariff on India. Will Sensex, Nifty crash today?The GIFT Nifty futures, which reflect early cues for the market, were trading 179 points lower at 24,675, down 0.73%, signalling a weak start for Dalal Street.

US imposes 25% tariff on India: What it means for exports and key sectorsThe newly announced duties target several of India's top-performing export sectors, like auto components, steel, aluminum, smartphones, gems and jewellery. Pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and critical minerals, however, have been excluded.

How the subscription lifestyle is fuelling a new wave of debtFrom entertainment and food to wellness and shopping, subscription models are everywhere. While they promise convenience, they're also leading many into silent debt traps, especially the younger, digital-savvy crowd.
Sensex closes 144 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; L&T up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 143.91 points to close at 81,481.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 33.95 points to end at 24,855.05.

M&B Engineering IPO: Should you subscribe? Check GMP, subscription on Day 1The IPO consists of a fresh equity issue worth Rs 275 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) worth Rs 375 crore by the company's promoters.

Only 1.35% central government staff opt for Unified Pension Scheme. Here's whyAs of July 20, 2025, only 30,989 employees have chosen UPS out of approximately 23 lakh (2.3 million) employees enrolled in NPS, marking a participation rate of just 1.35%.

How Pune man's insurance claim was denied thrice, then cleared after viral postWhile his wife was hospitalised, Sumit Kumar, a Pune-based business consultant, was battling paperwork, policy fine print, and silence from his insurer. This is his story.

NSDL IPO fully booked: Should you subscribe or skip Rs 4,000 crore listing?National Securities Depository Ltd (NSDL) aims to raise Rs 4,011.60 crore through a complete offer for sale (OFS) of 5.01 crore equity shares by existing shareholders.

NSDL IPO Day 1: Check latest subscription status, GMP and moreIn the grey market, NSDL's shares are commanding a premium of Rs 126, implying an estimated listing price of Rs 926—around 15.75 percent higher than the issue price.
TCS CEO's salary in focus amid mass layoff plan. Here's how much he earnsTCS recently confirmed it will let go of about 2% of its workforce in FY26, which translates to roughly 12,000 employees.

Infosys to hire 20,000 freshers in 2025, focus on AI: ReportInfosys CEO said that the IT firm has made early investments in AI and training its staff. So far, the company has trained about 2.75 lakh employees at different levels in AI and related areas.

ITR-3 online filing begins: Are you eligible and what's new?The Income Tax Department has kick-started online filing for ITR-3, bringing relief to taxpayers with more complex income sources. If you're wondering whether this applies to you and what's changed this year, here's everything in simple terms.

Talk money like you talk love: Investment advisor's advice for newlywedsAn investment advisor's advice to young couples goes beyond numbers. Abhishek Kumar emphasises that financial clarity is just as essential as emotional honesty when building a strong, lasting marriage.

GNG Electronics shares make bumper debut at 50% premium. Sell or hold?GNG Electronics shares listed at Rs 355 apiece on the NSE. This is nearly 50% higher than the IPO price of Rs 237 per share, giving early investors a sizeable gain on debut.

IMF lifts India's growth forecast for 2025 and 2026 to 6.4%India's steady growth projection comes as a bright spot in the global economic landscape, with the IMF stressing that policy continuity, labour reforms, and infrastructure investment will be crucial going forward.

Sensex and Nifty under pressure: What's behind Dalal Street's July slide?After months of strong gains, July brought a sobering pause to India's stock market rally. Expensive valuations, tepid earnings, and foreign outflows dragged indices down in a broad, sentiment-driven correction.
Sona Comstar sends cease-and-desist notice to Rani Kapur. What it meansSona Comstar has demanded that Rani Kapur withdraw her July 24 letter addressed to the board, shareholders, and stakeholders.

Explained: Why L&T share price jumped over 4% after Q1 resultsL&T reported a 30% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 3,617 crore for the April–June quarter, beating analyst estimates. Revenue from operations rose 16% YoY to Rs 63,679 crore.
Sensex opens 60 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; L&T up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 45.19 points to 81,383.14, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 12.55 points to 24,833.65 as of 9:32 am.

Apple is shutting a store in China for the first time. Here's whyFor the first time, Apple plans to shut a physical retail location in mainland China, a move that comes nearly two decades after it began operations there.

Earthquake and Trump tariff heat: Will stock markets open lower today?At 7:50 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,825 points, suggesting that the Nifty 50 will open near Tuesday's closing level of 24,821.1.

Is the India-US trade deal on track? Trump shares new updateDonald Trump had earlier announced higher tariffs in April but delayed them by introducing a reduced 10% levy to allow room for negotiations. With the August 1 deadline approaching, pressure is building on both countries to make progress.

US delegation set to visit India on August 25 for key trade discussionsIndia is asking the US to remove the proposed 26% extra tariff and reduce high duties on Indian steel and aluminium products, which currently face tariffs of up to 50%.

Wife pays no income tax after selling two houses gifted by husbandA woman from Mumbai won a court case at the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT), which said she did not have to pay income tax after selling two flats worth Rs 6 crore.
Sensex ends 427 points higher; Nifty above 24,800; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 446.93 points to close at 81,337.95, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 140.20 points to end at 24,821.10.

Selling your house? Here's how you can save lakhs in taxesSection 54 of the Income Tax Act allows exemption on long-term capital gains earned from the sale of a residential house or plot of land if the profit is reinvested in buying or constructing a new residential property in India.
HDFC, ICICI and 4 other banks offering high FD rates. Check nowICICI Bank also offers 6.6% interest, but on a longer tenure, between 2 and 10 years. For senior citizens, the rate is 7.10%.

Lenskart takes first step towards IPO, files draft with SebiAccording to the draft papers, the IPO will include a fresh issue of shares worth up to Rs 2,150 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of up to 13.23 crore shares by existing shareholders.

EU-sanctioned refiner Nayara turns to Rediff after Microsoft suspension: ReportThe shift comes in the wake of fresh European Union sanctions announced on July 18 that targeted Nayara for its links to Russia.

entertainment.headline: Nishaanchi first look: Aaishvary Thackeray debuts in Anurag Kashyap's crime sagaAmazon MGM Studios India revealed the first-look poster of 'Nishaanchi', directed by Anurag Kashyap. The film features Aaishvary Thackeray in a gripping double role and promises intense action and drama.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot Episode 2: Tulsi gets body-shamed at her partyIn the new episode of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot, Tulsi is body-shamed and age-shamed. She is told by her daughter that she doesn't take good care of her health, while the guests discuss how Mihir is way better looking than his partner.

Asha Parekh, Waheeda Rehman and Helen enjoy dinner dateAsha Parekh, Waheeda Rehman, and Helen, recently enjoyed a dinner outing in Mumbai. The 'Kati Patang' actor shared a picture from their dinner date on social media.
Courtney Cox calls Friends co-star Lisa Kudrow her loot in touching birthday postActor Courtney Cox shared the most touching birthday post for her "loot" Lisa Kudrow. The latter turned 62 on July 30.

Love, Money, Madness and Fame: The Enduring Philosophy of Kishore KumarOn August 4, 2025, we celebrate what would have been the 96th birthday of Kishore Kumar—the legendary singer, actor, and filmmaker whose unparalleled talent and eccentric charm left an indelible imprint on Indian cinema. In this series, we explore the multifaceted life of this enigmatic genius, delving into his complex relationships with love, marriage, money, madness, and fame. The first part of this special series traces Kishore's quest for love—a journey marked by passion, heartbreak, and resilience—tragically cut short by his sudden death in 1987.

Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal ferry-off to Alibaug together, video goes viralKatrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal were recently seen heading to Alibaug. Katrina's outfit and their low-key appearance sparked fresh pregnancy rumours.

5 Bollywood romantic films Gen-Z will relate to if they liked Saiyaara so muchWhile the popularity of Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' refuses to slow down, Gen-Z is beginning to look back at a time when love unfolded through soulful songs and heartfelt monologues in Bollywood. As the 2000s romantic classics find new life through re-releases and streaming platforms, today's generation is rediscovering what it truly means to fall-and grow-in love.

Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom team meets Pawan Kalyan on Ustaad Bhagat Singh setVijay Deverakonda and the team of his upcoming movie 'Kingdom' met Pawan Kalyan on the sets of 'Ustaad Bhagat Singh'. 'Kingdom' hit theatres today.

Saiyaara box office Day 13: Rs 300 crore a cakewalk for Ahaan Panday's film nowYRF's 'Saiyaara' is moving towards the Rs 300 crore club. The Mohit Suri-directorial is in its third weekend, and it will now face 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' at the box office.

Coldplay to Travis Scott: Indian concerts may create 12 million jobs; are we ready?India's live concert economy is rapidly expanding, projected to create 12 million jobs by 2032. This growth highlights opportunities in tier 2 and 3 cities but also underscores skill shortages needing urgent attention.

Karisma in Delhi with children amid Sanjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore estate battleActor Karisma Kapoor arrived in Delhi with her children, Kiaan and Samaira, amid her late ex-husband Sunjay Kapur's property feud.

Kerala Rapper Vedan faces sexual assault case over false promise of marriageA sexual harassment case has been registered against Kerala rapper Vedan involving allegations of a false promise of marriage. He was previously arrested in a drug-related case.

Head Over Heels review: Choo Young Woo, Cho Yi-hyun shine in wholesome K-drama'Head Over Heels' is a fresh K-drama blending young love with Korean mythology. The series delivers a heartfelt story with strong performances, available on Prime Video India.

Vijay Sethupathi slams filthy sexual harassment claims, takes legal actionActor Vijay Sethupathi has finally spoken out regarding serious casting couch allegations made against him by a woman on social media.
In Nick- Priyanka's July, beach, broadway, and Malti stealing spotlightOn July 31, Nick Jonas shared heartfelt moments from July with Priyanka Chopra and Malti on social media.

Raj Nidimoru miffed at paps after casual dinner date with Samantha in Mumbai. PicsActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu and director Raj Nidimoru stepped out on a dinner date in Mumbai amid relationship rumours. Neither has confirmed their relationship status despite public interest.

Kingdom X review: Vijay Deverakonda delivers career-best act in emotional filmVijay Deverakonda's 'Kingdom' released on July 31 amid massive anticipation. Internet users on X, who caught the early shows, called it one of his best performances in his career.

Zootopia 2 trailer: Nick, Judy attend couple counselling amid giant snake chaseZootopia 2 trailer: Rookie cops Nick and Judy seek couple counselling while solving a mysterious case of a giant snake on the leash. The upcoming animation film is scheduled for a theatrical release on November 28.

Jamie Lee Curtis says plastic surgery has led to genocide of women, slams AI filtersActor Jamie Lee Curtis called plastic surgery a 'genocide' of natural beauty. She also warned against AI filters as they worsen unrealistic beauty standards for women.

general news.headline: No evidence: All Malegaon blast accused, including Pragya Thakur, acquittedMalegaon blasts verdict: The blasts in Malegaon killed six people and injured over 100. Seventeen years later, all the seven accused have been acquitted.

Dharmasthala case: Partial skeletal remains found at 6th site, first with evidencePartial skeletal remains have been found at the sixth site in Dharmasthala's mass burial probe as investigators intensify efforts to verify allegations made by a former sanitation worker about multiple burials in the temple town.
US calls India the 'tariff king'. But its own duties go as high as 350%Donald Trump has called India tariff king, but the U.S. quietly charges 350% on milk, tobacco, and fruit.

ENG vs IND 5th Test: Can riled-up India land final punch to square series?Having secured a draw in Manchester, India have a great chance to level the series at the Oval against a depleted England side. Shubman Gill and his men have batted and bowled out of their skins time and again in the series so far, and now have a chance to punch above their weight in the finale.

Why India returned Haji Pir Pass to Pakistan after capturing it in 1965India captured the Haji Pir Pass in 1965 in a big military achievement, but returned it to Pakistan just months later under the Tashkent Agreement. Critics argue that the move compromised long-term security in Kashmir. But why did India give control of Haji Pir Pass to Pakistan despite wresting the strategic site from it?

I'm dying or they'll kill me: Pregnant Kerala woman's text to mother before suicideA 23-year-old pregnant woman from Kerala's Thrissur died by suicide after sending her mother a chilling message: "I am going to die, or they will kill me." Police have remanded her husband and mother-in-law under abetment to suicide and other relevant provisions.

Can take their dead economies down together: Trump hits out at India, RussiaIn a fiery post on Truth Social, Trump doubled down on his long-standing gripe over India's trade practices, accusing the country of levying "among the highest tariffs in the world" and blaming New Delhi for what he claimed was "very little business" between the two nations.

Jat conundrum: Jagdeep Dhankar's exit bares BJP's struggle with communityEngineering a Jat breakthrough for long, the BJP has instead built a fragile edifice of borrowed faces and paper alliances, just one defection or protest away from collapse

From dual incomes to debt: The silent struggle of parents paying private school feesMiddle-class Indian families struggle with sharply rising private school fees and related lifestyle changes. Despite existing fee regulations, poor enforcement leaves parents bearing heavy financial and emotional costs.

Became sanyasi 2 years before blast: What court said on Pragya ThakurA special court acquitted Sadhvi Pragya and Lt Colonel Prasad Purohit - the face of the Malegaon case - 17 years after a blast rocked the communally sensitive town.

Trump's 25% tariff on India, and what it means nextIn a shock move that rattled both diplomacy and markets, the US announced a sweeping 25% tariff on all Indian exports starting August 1, 2025. How did this happen? What's behind such a drastic step? And where do things go from here? We answer all your questions.

Ex-Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam exits NDA hours after meeting MK Stalin during morning walkIn a significant political development in Tamil Nadu, expelled AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam announced his exit from the NDA, just hours after a morning meeting with Chief Minister MK Stalin.

Glad Trump stated facts: Rahul Gandhi backs 'dead economy' remark on IndiaRahul Gandhi backed Donald Trump's "dead economy" remark, accusing PM Modi of destroying India's economy. He questioned Modi's silence on the 25 percent US tariff and said the government has failed on the economic front.

The Trumpian paradox: For India, its riskier being his friend than rivalTrump threw a curveball at India by announcing a 25% tariff on merchandise exports plus an undisclosed penalty. On the other hand, Trump keeps extending the deadline for China, a noted adversary.
China launches Pakistan's remote-sensing satellite-01 into spaceThe satellite quickly achieved its preset orbit, and mission controllers confirmed that all systems were operating as planned.

Jayanti Reddy's second ICW outing nails luxe sustainabilityIn her collection Reclaimed Opulence, Jayanti Reddy explored what it means to carry forward India's sartorial legacy in a way that speaks to the modern, global Indian woman.

Maybe they'll sell to India: Trump strikes trade deal, oil partnership with PakDonald Trump announced a new US-Pakistan oil trade deal, hinting it could pave the way for future exports to India. The move follows Trump's declaration of a 25% tariff and extra penalties on goods imported from India.

God will punish those who insulted 'bhagwa': Pragya Thakur after acquittalFormer BJP MP Pragya Thakur was acquitted in the 2008 Malegaon blast case after 17 years, with the court citing lack of reliable evidence. Reacting to the verdict, Pragya Thakur called it a victory for 'saffron' and justice.

Beyond raves and speakeasies, Delhi's past is redefining nightlifeDelhi after dark is not just coffee raves or pubs. Its historic allure is slowly reviving night tourism with lit-up tombs, museums and light and sound shows.

sports.headline: Harsh Tyagi ready for Delhi Warriors's vice-captaincy, looks up to Ravindra JadejaOuter Delhi Warriors vice-captain Harsh Tyagi, in an exclusive interaction with IndiaToday.in, advised every young player in the DPL to treat pressure as a blessing and use it as an opportunity to showcase their true potential.

Intense ENG vs IND series will help sell more Ashes tickets: CA CEOCricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg feels the aggressive India-England series will boost Ashes 2025 ticket sales. Greenberg is eager to welcome the England team to the Australian shorts in November.

DPL T20: Siddhant Sharma ready to lead IPL star-studded Outer Delhi Warriors squadIn an exclusive interaction with IndiaToday.in, captain Siddhant Sharma expressed his excitement and gratitude at being entrusted with the responsibility of leading the team, adding that he is already learning a great deal under the mentorship of Parthiv Patel.

5th Test, London Weather Live Updates: Will rain delay start of play on Day 1?India (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, London Weather Day 1 Live Updates: India and England are set to face off in the final Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, with the hosts holding a 2-1 lead and the visitors eager to level the series. Titans vs Thalaivas in opener, Vizag, Jaipur, Chennai, Delhi return as venuesThe Pro Kabaddi League season 12 is all set to kickstart from August 29 in Vizag with the Telugu Titans taking on Tamil Thalaivas in the opening match. The PKL will take place across four cities this season.

Football fever returns to Imphal as TRAU FC, NEROCA clash in Durand Cup openerNEROCA FC snatched a dramatic 1-1 draw against 10-man TRAU FC in their Group E opener at the 134th IndianOil Durand Cup in Imphal on Wednesday.

Mhatre to lead, Suryavanshi retained as India announce U19 squad for AUS tourAyush Mhatre will captain the India U19 side on their Australia tour starting September. The squad retains core players from the England tour, aiming to build on recent successes.

In addition, Conway's unbeaten fifty took the visitors to 92/0, putting them firmly in control.

Four IPL team owners confirmed as "strategic partners" for The Hundred teamsOn Wednesday, the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced that four Indian Premier League franchise owners have been confirmed as "strategic partners" for teams in 'The Hundred'. These owners will assume operational control by October 1 this year.
